ezvcard.io.xml

Class XCardOutputProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<String,String>
        • ezvcard.io.xml.XCardOutputProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<String,String>

    public class XCardOutputProperties
extends HashMap<String,String>
    Helper class for setting commonly-used JAXP output properties.
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • XCardOutputProperties

        public XCardOutputProperties()

      • XCardOutputProperties

        public XCardOutputProperties(Integer indent,
                             String xmlVersion)
        Parameters:
        indent - the number of indent spaces to use for pretty-printing or null to disable pretty-printing (disabled by default)
        xmlVersion - the XML version to use (defaults to "1.0") (Note: Many JDKs only support 1.0 natively. For XML 1.1 support, add a JAXP library like xalan to your project)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the indent amount is less than zero

    • Method Detail

      • getIndent

        public Integer getIndent()
        Gets the number of indent spaces to use for pretty-printing.
        Returns:
        the number of indent spaces or null if pretty-printing is disabled

      • setIndent

        public void setIndent(Integer indent)
        Sets the number of indent spaces to use for pretty-printing (disabled by default).
        Parameters:
        indent - the number of indent spaces to use or null to disable pretty-printing
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the indent amount is less than zero

      • getXmlVersion

        public String getXmlVersion()
        Gets the XML version to use.
        Returns:
        the XML version or null if not set

      • setXmlVersion

        public void setXmlVersion(String version)

        Sets the XML version to use (defaults to "1.0").

        Note: Many JDKs only support 1.0 natively. For XML 1.1 support, add a JAXP library like xalan to your project.

        Parameters:
        version - the XML version or null to remove
